justification: “Psychological well-being was measured using the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) measured in each wave, a 12-item scale…”

measured_by: single-item general risk question (1–10 willingness to take risks)
justification: “We use the general risk question ("Are you generally a person who is fully prepared to take risks or do you try to avoid taking risks?" from 1 … to 10 …) … as our measure of risk preferences.”
“All adults completed a 10-item delayed gratification scale … taken from a longer scale (Hoerger et al., 2011).”

measured_by: financial expectations question about being better/worse off next year
justification: “Financial expectations ("Looking ahead, how do you think you yourself will be financially a year from now; better than you are now, worse than you are now, or about the same?") … To measure an individual's anticipatory emotions…”

measured_by: financial realization question about being better/worse off than last year
justification: “Financial realizations ("Would you say that you yourself are better off, worse off or about the same financially than you were a year ago?") were measured in each wave … to capture reactive emotions.”
construct: reactive emotions to gains and losses
